medical_history.chief_complaint: Hyperthyroidism associated with goiter and exophthalmia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hyperthyroidism was evident at the age of 6 days, associated with a goiter and exophthalmia. The condition was persistent, monitored regularly, and required high doses of carbimazole and L-T4 treatment during follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born small for gestational age and preterm at 32.5 weeks gestation with a heterozygous germline mutation in the TSH receptor gene leading to constitutive activation.
medical_history.family_history: There is no familial history of thyroid disease.
